intro: Echeandia flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible echeandia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Echeandia flexuosa is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
